main event: On January 1, 1957, in Russell, Kansas, a civilian reported sighting one round blue-white object, the size of a pea at arm's length, moving from East to West and disappearing at a high rate of speed after being seen for a few seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as a round blue-white object, the size of a pea at arm's length.
It moved from East to West and disappeared at a high rate of speed after being seen for a few seconds.
The observation was made air-visually by a pilot flying a Convair-Continental 500 at 15,000 feet in Denver, Colorado.
The document lists possible conclusions including 'Astronomical Meteor', 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation', and 'Unknown'.
Weather and winds-aloft conditions at the time of the sighting were noted as CAVU (Ceiling and Visibility Unlimited) with varying wind speeds at different altitudes.
